The absence of official announcements: The expert mentions that no official announcements were made on 1 April 2018 regarding Daniel Radcliffe's return to the Harry Potter series or the production of a movie called "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child."
Basis in fact: The expert explains that while the claim may have seemed believable, it was a hoax. However, they acknowledge that there is a play called "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" based on a short story by J.K. Rowling, John Tiffany, and Jack Thorne, which has been running in London since 2016 and is set to open on Broadway in April 2018. This provides context to the claim but doesn't validate the specific movie announcement.
The origin of the fan: made poster: The expert mentions that the movie poster circulating on Facebook was created by someone named "BlueWolfArtista" and was shared as "concept art" and "photomanipulation." They also note that the image of the cursed child was created by altering a still shot of actor Asa Butterfield from the movie Ender's Game. This information adds to the evidence that the claim is not authentic.
Unreliable sources: The expert points out that while some Facebook pages presented the poster as genuine, others admitted that the movie news was nothing more than a hoax. This highlights the lack of consensus and credibility among the sources sharing the claim.
